main event: A civilian couple observed an unidentified flying object near Henderson, North Carolina on April 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as an oval-shaped, low-flying object that was bright and appeared to be spinning.
The object passed over the couple's car at a height of 100-150 feet and made no sound.
The sighting lasted only a few seconds before the object disappeared.
The couple was concerned about the publicity of the sighting and did not want their identities made known.
Investigators considered the possibility that the object could have been a kite, a balloon, or a meteor, but were unable to conclusively identify it.
